sentences.en: A methane molecule is composed of one carbon atom attached to four hydrogens.
sentences.cn: 甲烷分子由1个碳原子与4个氢原子构成。

sentences.en: As the waste materials decompose, they produce methane gas.
sentences.cn: 废物腐烂时会产生沼气。

sentences.en: Bacteria break down the animal waste to form methane gas.
sentences.cn: 细菌使动物粪便分解成沼气.

sentences.en: Coal - gas, obtained from the distillation of coal is mainly a mixture of hydrogen and methane.
sentences.cn: 煤经蒸馏以后所得到的煤气主要是氢气和甲烷的混合物.

sentences.en: Compounds such as methane can be cleaved to carbon and hydrogen.
sentences.cn: 象甲烷这样的化合物能分解为碳和氢.

sentences.en: Methane gas does collect in the mines around here.
sentences.cn: 周围的矿井里的确有沼气聚积。

sentences.en: Methane is often regarded as the second most important greenhouse gas after carbon dioxide.
sentences.cn: 甲烷常被认为是仅次于二氧化碳的重要温室气体。

sentences.en: Methane is one of the principal gases contributing to the greenhouse effect.
sentences.cn: 甲烷是造成温室效应的主要气体之一。

sentences.en: Methane is said to be hydrophobic.
Others monitor methane, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and all sorts of particles.
sentences.cn: 其他设备则监测着甲烷 、 一氧化碳 、 臭氧 、 铅以及其他各种粒子的浓度.

sentences.en: The gas , which is sulphur - free , contains 89 - 99 % methane, up to 6 % ethane, and 3 % propane.
sentences.cn: 天然气不含硫, 含甲烷88-99%, 乙烷6%和丙烷3%.

sentences.en: The ignition of methane gas killed eight men.
The variation in urine and methane production compensates partly for the plane of nutrition effect.
sentences.cn: 尿液和甲烷气体的变化部分地代偿了营养水平的影响.

sentences.en: They were able to nitrate methane to nitromethane.
sentences.cn: 他们能将甲烷硝化成硝基甲烷.

trans.tran_en: a gas that you cannot see or smell, which can be burned to give heat
